member.name: T:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.ADsPathsProviders
member.summary: Indicates the ADsPaths provider type of the DirectoryObjectPickerDialog. This provider affects the contents of the ADPath returned

member.name: F:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.ADsPathsProviders.WinNT
member.summary:
The ADsPaths are converted to use the WinNT provider.
The ADsPath string for the ADSI WinNT provider can be one of the following forms:
WinNT: WinNT://<domain name> WinNT://<domain name>/<server> WinNT://<domain name>/<path> WinNT://<domain name>/<object name> WinNT://<domain name>/<object name>,<object class> WinNT://<server> WinNT://<server>/<object name> WinNT://<server>/<object name>,<object class>
The domain name can be either a NETBIOS name or a DNS name. The server is the name of a specific server within the domain. The path is the path of on object, such as "printserver1/printer2". The object name is the name of a specific object. The object class is the class name of the named object. One example of this usage would be "WinNT://MyServer/JeffSmith,user". Specifying a class name can improve the performance of the bind operation.

member.name: F:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.ADsPathsProviders.LDAP
member.summary:
The ADsPaths are converted to use the LDAP provider.
The Microsoft LDAP provider ADsPath requires the following format.
LDAP://HostName[:PortNumber][/DistinguishedName]
Further info, see .

member.name: F:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.ADsPathsProviders.GC
member.summary: The ADsPaths for objects selected from this scope are converted to use the GC provider.

member.name: F:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.ADsPathsProviders.SIDPath
member.summary:
The ADsPaths having an objectSid attribute are converted to the form
LDAP://<SID=x>
where x represents the hexadecimal digits of the objectSid attribute value.

member.name: F:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.ADsPathsProviders.DownlevelBuiltinPath
member.summary:
The ADsPaths for down-level, well-known SID objects are an empty string unless this flag is specified (For example; DSOP_DOWNLEVEL_FILTER_INTERACTIVE). If this flag is specified, the paths have the form:
WinNT://NT AUTHORITY/Interactive
or:
WinNT://Creator owner

member.name: T:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.DirectoryObject
member.summary: Details of a directory object selected in the DirectoryObjectPickerDialog.

member.name: P:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.DirectoryObject.Path
member.summary: Gets the Active Directory path for this directory object.

remarks.para: The format of this string depends on the options specified in the DirectoryObjectPickerDialog from which this object was selected.

member.name: P:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.DirectoryObject.SchemaClassName
member.summary: Gets the name of the schema class for this directory object (objectClass attribute).

member.name: P:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.DirectoryObject.Name
member.summary: Gets the directory object's relative distinguished name (RDN).

member.name: P:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.DirectoryObject.Upn
member.summary: Gets the objects user principal name (userPrincipalName attribute).

remarks.para: If the object does not have a userPrincipalName value, this property is an empty string.

member.name: P:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.DirectoryObject.FetchedAttributes
member.summary: Gets attributes retrieved by the object picker as it makes the selection.

member.name: T:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.DSObjectPicker
member.summary: The object picker dialog box.

member.name: T:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.IDsObjectPicker
member.summary: The IDsObjectPicker interface is used by an application to initialize and display an object picker dialog box.

member.name: T:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.IDataObject
member.summary: Interface to enable data transfers

member.name: T:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.DirectoryObjectPickerDialog
member.summary: Represents a common dialog that allows a user to select directory objects.

remarks.para: The directory object picker dialog box enables a user to select one or more objects from either the global catalog, a Microsoft Windows 2000 domain or computer, a Microsoft Windows NT 4.0 domain or computer, or a workgroup. The object types from which a user can select include user, contact, group, and computer objects.
This managed class wraps the Directory Object Picker common dialog from the Active Directory UI.

It simplifies the scope (Locations) and filter (ObjectTypes) selection by allowing a single filter to be specified which applies to all scopes (translating to both up-level and down-level filter flags as necessary).

The object type filter is also simplified by combining different types of groups (local, global, etc) and not using individual well known types in down-level scopes (only all well known types can be specified).
The scope location is also simplified by combining down-level and up-level variations into a single locations flag, e.g. external domains.

member.name: M:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.DirectoryObjectPickerDialog.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor. Sets all properties to their default values.

remarks.para: The default values for the DirectoryObjectPickerDialog properties are:

member.name: P:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.DirectoryObjectPickerDialog.AllowedLocations
member.summary: Gets or sets the scopes the DirectoryObjectPickerDialog is allowed to search.

member.name: P:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.DirectoryObjectPickerDialog.AllowedObjectTypes
member.summary: Gets or sets the types of objects the DirectoryObjectPickerDialog is allowed to search for.

member.name: P:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.DirectoryObjectPickerDialog.DefaultLocations
member.summary: Gets or sets the initially selected scope in the DirectoryObjectPickerDialog.

member.name: P:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.DirectoryObjectPickerDialog.DefaultObjectTypes
member.summary: Gets or sets the initially seleted types of objects in the DirectoryObjectPickerDialog.

member.name: P:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.DirectoryObjectPickerDialog.Providers
member.summary: Gets or sets the providers affecting the ADPath returned in objects.

member.name: P:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.DirectoryObjectPickerDialog.MultiSelect
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the user can select multiple objects.

remarks.para: If this flag is false, the user can select only one object.

member.name: P:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.DirectoryObjectPickerDialog.SkipDomainControllerCheck
member.summary: Gets or sets the whether to check whether the target is a Domain Controller and hide the "Local Computer" scope

remarks.para:
From MSDN:
If this flag is NOT set, then the DSOP_SCOPE_TYPE_TARGET_COMPUTER flag will be ignored if the target computer is a DC. This flag has no effect unless DSOP_SCOPE_TYPE_TARGET_COMPUTER is specified.

member.name: P:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.DirectoryObjectPickerDialog.AttributesToFetch
member.summary: An list of LDAP attribute names that will be retrieved for picked objects

member.name: P:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.DirectoryObjectPickerDialog.SelectedObject
member.summary: Gets the directory object selected in the dialog, or null if no object was selected.

remarks.para: If MultiSelect is enabled, then this property returns only the first selected object. Use SelectedObjects to get an array of all objects selected.

member.name: P:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.DirectoryObjectPickerDialog.SelectedObjects
member.summary: Gets an array of the directory objects selected in the dialog.

member.name: P:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.DirectoryObjectPickerDialog.ShowAdvancedView
member.summary: Gets or sets whether objects flagged as show in advanced view only are displayed (up-level).

member.name: P:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.DirectoryObjectPickerDialog.TargetComputer
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the target computer.

remarks.para: The dialog box operates as if it is running on the target computer, using the target computer to determine the joined domain and enterprise. If this value is null or empty, the target computer is the local computer.

member.name: M:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.DirectoryObjectPickerDialog.Reset
member.summary: Resets all properties to their default values.

member.name: M:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.DirectoryObjectPickerDialog.SetCredentials(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Use this method to override the user credentials, passing new credentials for the account profile to be used.

member.name: M:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.DirectoryObjectPickerDialog.RunDialog(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Displays the Directory Object Picker (Active Directory) common dialog, when called by ShowDialog.
member.param: Handle to the window that owns the dialog.
member.returns: If the user clicks the OK button of the Directory Object Picker dialog that is displayed, true is returned; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.IntPtrExtensions.OffsetWith(System.IntPtr,System.Int64)
member.summary: Adds an offset to the value of a pointer.
member.param: The pointer to add the offset to.
member.returns: A new pointer that reflects the addition of to .

member.name: T:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.NameTranslator
member.summary: Active Directory name translation.

remarks.para: Translates names between Active Directory formats, e.g. from down-level NT4 style names ("ACME\alice") to User Principal Name ("alice@acme.com").
This utility class encapsulates the ActiveDs.dll COM library.

member.name: M:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.NameTranslator.TranslateDownLevelToUpn(System.String)
member.summary: Convert from a down-level NT4 style name to an Active Directory User Principal Name (UPN).

member.name: M:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.NameTranslator.TranslateUpnToDownLevel(System.String)
member.summary: Convert from an Active Directory User Principal Name (UPN) to a down-level NT4 style name.

member.name: T:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.ObjectTypes
member.summary: Indicates the type of objects the DirectoryObjectPickerDialog searches for.

member.name: F:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.ObjectTypes.None
member.summary: No object types.

member.name: F:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.ObjectTypes.Users
member.summary: Includes user objects.

member.name: F:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.ObjectTypes.Groups
member.summary: Includes security groups with universal scope.

remarks.para: In an up-level scope, this includes distribution and security groups, with universal, global and domain local scope.
In a down-level scope, this includes local and global groups.

member.name: F:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.ObjectTypes.Computers
member.summary: Includes computer objects.

member.name: F:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.ObjectTypes.Contacts
member.summary: Includes contact objects.

member.name: F:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.ObjectTypes.BuiltInGroups
member.summary: Includes built-in group objects.

summary.para: In an up-level scope, this includes group objects with the built-in groupType flags.
In a down-level scope, not setting this object type excludes local built-in groups.

member.name: F:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.ObjectTypes.WellKnownPrincipals
member.summary: Includes all well-known security principals.

remarks.para: In an up-level scope, this includes the contents of the Well Known Security Principals container.
In a down-level scope, this includes all well-known SIDs.

member.name: F:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.ObjectTypes.ServiceAccounts
member.summary: Includes all service accounts and group managed service accounts.

member.name: F:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.ObjectTypes.All
member.summary: All object types.

member.name: T:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.Locations
member.summary: Indicates the scope the DirectoryObjectPickerDialog searches for objects.

member.name: F:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.Locations.None
member.summary: No locations.

member.name: F:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.Locations.LocalComputer
member.summary: The target computer (down-level).

member.name: F:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.Locations.JoinedDomain
member.summary: A domain to which the target computer is joined (down-level and up-level).

member.name: F:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.Locations.EnterpriseDomain
member.summary: All Windows 2000 domains in the enterprise to which the target computer belongs (up-level).

member.name: F:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.Locations.GlobalCatalog
member.summary: A scope containing objects from all domains in the enterprise (up-level).

member.name: F:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.Locations.ExternalDomain
member.summary: All domains external to the enterprise, but trusted by the domain to which the target computer is joined (down-level and up-level).

member.name: F:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.Locations.Workgroup
member.summary: The workgroup to which the target computer is joined (down-level).

remarks.para: Applies only if the target computer is not joined to a domain. The only type of object that can be selected from a workgroup is a computer.

member.name: F:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.Locations.UserEntered
member.summary: Enables the user to enter a scope (down-level and up-level).

remarks.para: If not specified, the dialog box restricts the user to the scopes in the locations drop-down list.

member.name: F:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.Locations.All
member.summary: All locations.

member.name: M:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.PInvoke.GlobalLock(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: The GlobalLock function locks a global memory object and returns a pointer to the first byte of the object's memory block. GlobalLock function increments the lock count by one. Needed for the clipboard functions when getting the data from IDataObject

member.name: M:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.PInvoke.GlobalUnlock(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: The GlobalUnlock function decrements the lock count associated with a memory object.

member.name: M:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.PInvoke.ReleaseStgMedium(Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.STGMEDIUM@)
member.summary: Frees the specified storage medium.
member.param: Pointer to the storage medium that is to be freed.

member.name: T:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.FORMATETC
member.summary: This structure is used as a parameter in OLE functions and methods that require data format information.

member.name: T:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.STGMEDIUM
member.summary: The STGMEDIUM structure is a generalized global memory handle used for data transfer operations by the IDataObject

member.name: T:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.DSOP_INIT_INFO
member.summary: The DSOP_INIT_INFO structure contains data required to initialize an object picker dialog box.

member.name: T:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.DSOP_SCOPE_INIT_INFO
member.summary: The DSOP_SCOPE_INIT_INFO structure describes one or more scope types that have the same attributes. A scope type is a type of location, for example a domain, computer, or Global Catalog, from which the user can select objects.

member.name: T:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.DSOP_UPLEVEL_FILTER_FLAGS
member.summary: The DSOP_UPLEVEL_FILTER_FLAGS structure contains flags that indicate the filters to use for an up-level scope. An up-level scope is a scope that supports the ADSI LDAP provider.

member.name: T:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.DSOP_FILTER_FLAGS
member.summary: The DSOP_FILTER_FLAGS structure contains flags that indicate the types of objects presented to the user for a specified scope or scopes.

member.name: T:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.DS_SELECTION
member.summary: The DS_SELECTION structure contains data about an object the user selected from an object picker dialog box. The DS_SELECTION_LIST structure contains an array of DS_SELECTION structures.

member.name: T:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.DS_SELECTION_LIST
member.summary: The DS_SELECTION_LIST structure contains data about the objects the user selected from an object picker dialog box. This structure is supplied by the IDataObject interface supplied by the IDsObjectPicker::InvokeDialog method in the CFSTR_DSOP_DS_SELECTION_LIST data format.

member.name: T:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.DSOP_SCOPE_TYPE_FLAGS
member.summary: Flags that indicate the scope types described by this structure. You can combine multiple scope types if all specified scopes use the same settings.

member.name: T:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.DSOP_INIT_INFO_FLAGS
member.summary: Flags that determine the object picker options.

member.name: T:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.DSOP_SCOPE_INIT_INFO_FLAGS
member.summary: Flags that indicate the format used to return ADsPath for objects selected from this scope. The flScope member can also indicate the initial scope displayed in the Look in drop-down list.

member.name: T:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.DSOP_FILTER_FLAGS_FLAGS
member.summary: Filter flags to use for an up-level scope, regardless of whether it is a mixed or native mode domain.

member.name: T:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.DSOP_DOWNLEVEL_FLAGS
member.summary: Contains the filter flags to use for down-level scopes

member.name: T:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.HRESULT
member.summary: The IDsObjectPicker.InvokeDialog result

member.name: T:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.CLIPBOARD_FORMAT
member.summary: The CFSTR_DSOP_DS_SELECTION_LIST clipboard format is provided by the IDataObject obtained by calling IDsObjectPicker.InvokeDialog

member.name: T:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.TYMED
member.summary: The TYMED enumeration values indicate the type of storage medium being used in a data transfer.

member.name: T:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.DVASPECT
member.summary: The DVASPECT enumeration values specify the desired data or view aspect of the object when drawing or getting data.

member.name: T:Tulpep.ActiveDirectoryObjectPicker.ADS_NAME_TYPE_ENUM
member.summary: Directory name types for use with IADsNameTranslate
